alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 4:27PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coconino County through 530 PM MST/630 PM MDT/... At 427 PM MST/527 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Marble Canyon to 6 miles east of House Rock. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, heavy rain, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bitter Springs and Marble Canyon. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 523 and 539. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 565. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
